20050000.text: I bet you've been on a lot of adventures, right?

20050001.text: It wasn't much of an adventure.

20050002.text:
You're being far too humble.
Rumors are already being spread among the apprentices of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20050003.text:
You've endured numerous Fates
and saved the world from various dangers.

20050005.text:
Ah, such sincere humility...
I can't help but respect you.

20050007.text:
The disciples of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> enter at a young age
and begin their communal life there.

20050008.text:
Although they do try broaden their experience,
the opportunities to do that here are pretty limited.

20050009.text:
So, could you help the students out a little, as a teacher?
Won't you give them some advice?

20050010.text:
Ah, you've traveled a long way to get here.
I've heard a lot about you!

20050012.text:
I do know of you.
You're the one who's shared joys and sorrows with our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Clan Leader</>, aren't you?

20050014.text:
Do you have any advice
or instructions for us?

20050015.text:
I'm not wise enough to do that.
Actually, I've come here to ask a question.

20050016.text:
Please, go ahead and just ask.
I'll be happy to answer if I can.

20050017.text: Do you know anything about the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol Quarters</>?

20050018.text:
This place? An expedition in the past ventured to the east
and discovered a Giant Caelite.

20050019.text:
We discovered that the Caelite
was, in fact, related to the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Advocate</> that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> served!

20050020.text:
So, we set up this <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Haewol Branch</>
to commemorate and preserve that Caelite.

20050021.text: There are fewer people here than I expected.

20050022.text:
Currently, it's time for training and cleaning,
according to the 4th curriculum timetable.

20050023.text:
Ah, yes... So, this training is for the purpose of
eliminating enemies near this <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>branch</>.

20050024.text: and to obtain some practical experience.

20050025.text: The curriculum and timetable look great. Wow.

20050026.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> has a long history.
Our excellent curriculum is why we attract so many people with talent.

20050028.text:
Certainly. Then, would you follow me?
I'll guide you there.

20050029.text:
Most of the apprentices have already returned.
We're a little late.

20050030.text:
This is enough since there
are still some people left.

20050031.text:
Thank you for your consideration.
But it'll be boring if you simply stand around and watch.

20050032.text: Could you help us drive out the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Oduksinis</>?

20050033.text: (I was going to say I wasn't bored, but I should just nod now.)

20050034.text: We don't want to fight the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Oduksini</>, either.

20050035.text: But they're expanding their forces, so we have to drive them away.

20050036.text: Erm... Actually, I don't know if I'm allowed to ask you this...

20050038.text:
What is your relationship with our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Clan Leader</>?
There's been all kinds of talk among the apprentices.

20050040.text:
Well... It's slightly... I guess it's not really important.
They're probably saying that because they don't know any better.

20050041.text: We're simply colleagues who studied under the same teacher.

20050042.text: I thought so. I did hear that our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Clan Leader</> had another teacher.

20050043.text:
Clan Leader <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> became our Leader by breaking the rules of <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>... 
It's a bit hard to believe that he had a teacher of his own.

20050044.text: What rule did he break to become the Clan Leader?

20050045.text:
The rule was that only a child of the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>former Clan Leader</> could inherit the role of Leader.
So, everyone thought that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Song Sigook</> would become the next Leader.

20050046.text:
I remember how startled they all were
after the announcement that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> was to become the Clan Leader.

20050047.text:
Please forget about that last thing I said.
I really shouldn't be telling that to anyone outside <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20050049.text: (Perhaps he's here to cause trouble at <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>?)

20050050.text: Come at me! I'll take on the world!

20050052.text:
My skills seem to have gotten better recently.
I'm actually pretty surprised.

20050053.text:
At this point, my own peers might not even be enough of a challenge.
Hey, aren't you getting too cocky? Haha!

20050055.text:
It would mean defying fate if a person such as I
ignored the troubles and pain of the people, wouldn't it?

20050056.text: It's good to help other people.

20050057.text:
In that sense, I believe there's a problem with <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.
The people are suffering from the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>bats</> appearing in the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Caelite Lands</>.

20050058.text:
I don't know what we're doing...
I'll get you, you <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>black winged monsters</>!

20050059.text:
Everybody knows that the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Caelite Land</> is managed by <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>...
If they just leave the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>bats</> alone, they'll be seen as dishonorable cowards.

20050060.text: My advise is that it's still best to work with others.

20050061.text:
I already tried to persuade them. The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>bats</> are eating people as food!
The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> should do something about this!

20050062.text:
But the Clan Leader is nowhere to be found,
and the Great Elder keeps trying to talk me out of it.

20050063.text: There must be a reason. The danger may be too great for now.

20050064.text:
I'm not a child anymore.
And I'm certainly not stupid enough to be unable to tell the difference.

20050065.text: Hey, what are you talking about? Ahem! Haha!

20050067.text:
It's all trivial matters that don't need your attention. Now I know that giant bat, the
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>White Night Gargoyle</>, is a tough opponent!

20050068.text: But I can still handle a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Night Gargoyle</>, which is the size of a normal bat.

20050069.text:
It's not even a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>White Night Gargoyle</>?
How could a common <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Night Gargoyle</> be so strong? Urgh...

20050070.text: It seems you need more training.

20050071.text:
I thought I had gotten considerably stronger, but it seems I was wrong.
The Great Elder knew about this, didn't he?

20050072.text:
I don't know myself,
but it's possible he might've known.

20050073.text:
I was watching you, and you're amazing.
I could feel the gap in ability between us.

20050074.text: I should return to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> and focus on my training.

20050075.text:
It's the right decision to make.
I wish you a safe trip back.

20050076.text:
Wait. There are a lot of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Night Gargoyles</>.
They're too dangerous for someone like me to handle alone...

20050077.text:
Provoking the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Night Gargoyles</> would bring trouble to the people here
and to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>...

20050079.text: Could you accompany me up to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Winged Monster Hunting Zone</>?

20050080.text: Oh! Now, there's a familiar face.

20050082.text: The residents in the region are suffering because of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>White Night Gargoyle</> and <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Giant Night Gargoyle</>...

20050083.text: I, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Jimmy Ace</>, the expert in Hesuth Hunting, can't miss an opportunity like this.

20050084.text: Technically, there's also something in it for me after I deal with this...

20050085.text: What are you muttering at the end?

20050086.text: Nothing. I was just saying that the suffering of the people is my own suffering, too.

20050087.text: I knew it! Captain, you really do care about the people!

20050088.text: You should know that you're lucky to be tasked with something so important...

20050089.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>White Night Gargoyle</> is a little too much... Are you ready
to help the residents by eliminating the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Giant Night Gargoyle</>?

20050090.text: This is a good chance. The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Giant Night Gargoyle</> is on its own.

20050092.text:
Looks like I was right all along.
However, you can take all the credit!

20050093.text: I prefer actual rewards more than credit...

20050095.text: Well, I suppose you can think of it as a reward from the heart.

20050096.text: Hey! You! You should be grateful to get an opportunity as good as this.

20050097.text: That's right! Why are you even asking that?

20050099.text:
I have a feeling that we'll meet again.
I'll be looking forward to when that happens.

20050100.text:
Oh! Look who's here!
Isn't it the honorary <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron Pioneer</> <textColor=[255:204:102:255]><myHero.name/></>, meow?

20050101.text: (I'm so happy to see <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Naypaw</> and the other <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Barons</>.)

20050102.text:
Did you fur-get our names
and mistake the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>leader</> for another Baron, meow?

20050103.text: No doubt about it. If that wasn't the case, you would've called us by name, meow!

20050104.text: Come on! Of course I know your names.

20050105.text: Hmph! So, fishing fur compliments, mrrow?

20050106.text: Rawr! That's right! If that wasn't the case, you would've called our names, too, mow!

20050107.text:
Now! Enough with the pleasantries!
We have a job for our honorary <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron member</>!

20050108.text: First, go to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Specter Hill</> and chase away the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Daybreak</>!

20050109.text: Recently, I won a big game at a pub and received a map, meow.

20050110.text:
According to the map, there's a <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>hidden cave</> at the vewy south of the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>hill</>, meow.
So, we've set up a camp near the area.

20050111.text: From looking at the map, it's not too hard to find.

20050112.text: Of course, purr. But the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Daybreak</> in the region are keeping us from approaching it.

20050113.text: The <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>leader</> gave up the camp and ran away first, hiss!

20050114.text: That's right! He ran away without even looking back at us, hiss!

20050115.text:
Hmm hmm! <myHero.name/>.
Would you help us again, mrrow?

20050117.text:
It's not because we're scared, mrrow!
It's just because we can't find the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>cave</>!

20050118.text: I've achieved yet another heroic feat!

20050119.text: Hmph! You'd better fix it quickly, hiss!

20050120.text:
Grr! That's right! 
He's trying to take all the credit for himself, hiss!

20050121.text: We've achieved another heroic feat, meow!

20050122.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Daybreak</> resisted fiercely, but...
We've achieved something great. I feel proud, purrr!

20050124.text:
<myHero.name/>,
you did well as an honorary <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Baron Pioneer</> too, meow!

20050125.text: Thank you. Take care of yourself.

20050126.text: I saw you at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Caelite Ruins</> before.

20050127.text: That's right. I was with him.

20050129.text:
Ah... I don't know that much about him.
I do have a good guess, though, so I can tell you that much.

20050130.text:
But I'm worried word might get out,
and this certainly isn't the best place.

20050131.text: Perhaps we could go somewhere else?

20050132.text:
Everybody believed that as the eldest son of the Clan Leader,
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Song Sigook</> would become the next Leader.

20050133.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> and <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Bi Ruha</> both showed great potential at a young age,
but nobody thought they'd have a chance of becoming the next Clan Leader.

20050134.text:
In <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>, the child of the Clan Leader traditionally becomes the next Leader,
so long as they don't have any fatal flaws.

20050135.text:
Young master <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Song Sigook</> might not have had the best skills.
However, he also wasn't lacking.

20050136.text:
Then, the Great Elder <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Song Moonak</> designated <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> as the Clan Leader.
It was that moment, I think, when everything started to go sideways...

20050137.text: Why did <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</> become the Clan Leader?

20050138.text:
I don't know the reason. Come to think of it,
it might be because they saw his extraordinary skills when he was young.

20050139.text:
Perhaps he thought it would be best for <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>
if <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Aran</>, rather than his child, became the Clan Leader?

20050140.text: Thank you for sharing your story.

20050142.text: I've come here to conduct all different kinds of research.

20050143.text: Recently, I found a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> when I went into the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dreamy Forest</>.

20050144.text: What's so special about a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</>? They can be found anywhere in the world.

20050145.text:
That's right. <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> can be found anywhere in the sea all over the world...
But they're usually not found in forests.

20050146.text: Why would a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> live in the forest?

20050147.text:
Ah, you're curious, too, just like me.
That's what I'm trying to figure out. What are those <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> doing out of the water?

20050148.text:
I can't stand it when questions are left unanswered...
So, would you like to join me in finding out?

20050150.text: What kind of help do you need?

20050151.text:
It'd be helpful if you could catch plenty of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> over there.
There's a lot of tests and experiments to do, so I'll need a lot of them.

20050152.text:
Maybe they could be eaten?
I do hope they're edible...

20050153.text: Good, good. Usually, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> have to live in water...

20050154.text: This is not the ocean. There are no bodies of water near here.

20050155.text:
The land here could have risen for some reason in the past.
Before that happened, maybe this place was a body of water.

20050156.text:
If we investigate the land around here, we might find seashells
that would prove this place used to be an ocean.

20050157.text: How can a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> live outside of water?

20050158.text: Well, first, I need to start researching that.

20050159.text:
I assume that they mutated for some reason...
There might have been several mutations over time, in fact.

20050160.text:
Among those mutations, there would've been a variation of a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>jellyfish</> that lives in the water,
and another capable of living on land.

20050161.text:
That means, of the various mutations, we might be looking at
the only variation that managed to survive.

20050162.text:
But I don't know the truth.
I do hope I can find the answer through my research.

20050163.text:
You've come all the way here...
Would you be willing to help me with my other research efforts, too?

20050164.text: What kind of research is that?

20050165.text:
There was a research project I've always wanted to do,
but let's just say that it was too difficult for me to do alone.

20050166.text: I might not be too helpful since I'm not a scientist.

20050167.text:
When I say difficult... I mean it's dangerous.
It's very dangerous.

20050168.text:
There's a powerful and scary monster living there.
If I tried to do any research there, it'd be the last work that I'd leave behind for the world...

20050169.text:
Actually, if that monster killed me, there wouldn't be any work for me to leave, would there?
Anyway... that's the reason I couldn't even attempt that research.

20050170.text: I can't see it from here. I'll try looking for some clues.

20050172.text:
Could you eliminate any approaching enemies
while I look for clues?

20050174.text: Let's go in from over there.

20050175.text:
It may get dangerous from here on out,
so please protect me.

20050178.text: Progress? I'm certain there's something nearby.

20050179.text:
I haven't been able to fully confirm it yet...
But I think I'm onto something pretty great.

20050180.text: The atmosphere in the area feels strange.

20050181.text:
I don't know the exact location...
but it's definitely nearby.

20050182.text:
If we search the area,
we'll definitely find it...

20050183.text:
I think we should stop here
since it might be too dangerous.

20050184.text: As far as I know, scholars typically don't often take risks.

20050185.text:
Well, some scholars can be pretty bold and foolhardy...
But I prefer to be careful. I can't die before finishing my work.

20050186.text:
If you really value your life...
I'd advise against searching for that monster.

20050188.text: How could you? All I wanted to do was continue my research. How dare you interfere with my work?

20050189.text: Sir, we're only telling you this because it's dangerous.

20050190.text: The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blueskins</> roam this area. It's not safe.

20050191.text: We should leave. It's too dangerous.

20050192.text:
Didn't I say I'd eat here!?
Didn't I say I'd sleep here!?

20050193.text: I won't leave! If you make me leave, it'll be in a coffin!

20050195.text:
During our patrol, we found the scholar in a dangerous area.
We asked him to leave because it's unsafe.

20050196.text: What? I'm a scholar. A scholar! How dare you try to stop me from working!?

20050197.text:
I might not be highly recognized, and I may not have any funding...
But even without money, I still have my pride!

20050198.text:
My teacher told me my theory wasn't worthwhile,
and that I should focus on something else...

20050199.text:
I'd rather starve to death than give up on my research.
I'll never quit!

20050200.text: What do you want to do?

20050201.text: You can stay by my side and protect me if you think it's too dangerous!

20050202.text: You can't possibly expect us to remain here the entire time and protect you.

20050203.text:
I'll say it again. I'll die if I have to.
Just don't interfere with my work!

20050204.text: You're not making this any easier.

20050205.text:
The strata here shouldn't be on the surface,
but deep inside the ground.

20050206.text: This is proof that the land rose up!

20050207.text:
Everybody knows that a dragon fell
and the land rose up from the aftermath of the impact.

20050208.text:
Did you see it for yourself? Did you?
Did you see the dragon fall and the land rise?

20050209.text:
The stories I've heard seem true.
But of course I've never witnessed it.

20050210.text:
I don't care for tall tales about falling dragons...
I just want to find evidence to prove that the land rose up.

20050211.text: I've found some great evidence, thanks to you! I appreciate it!

20050212.text:
And <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>you</>! I'm sorry for being rude earlier. Please forgive me.
I know you were just doing your job.

20050213.text:
I know you've been having a hard time dealing with the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Blueskins</>...
And I'm always grateful for your help.

20050214.text: I have a favor to ask. I hope you'll hear me out.

20050215.text: Let me hear about it first.

20050216.text:
There were several <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>geologists</> that came before me.
But for some reason, they all disappeared.

20050218.text:
There's no concrete evidence yet.
I thought they might've been kidnapped.

20050219.text:
While I've been conducting my research here,
I've also been looking for my colleagues at the same time.

20050220.text:
Where I'm heading to now is too dangerous for me to go alone.
Since you seem to be able to handle yourself in a fight, I was hoping you'd accompany me.

20050221.text:
I've found some clues that people were here.
They might have been the kidnappers.

20050222.text: Are the scholars going to be all right?

20050223.text: I don't know. But why in the world would anyone want those scholars?

20050224.text: Maybe for ransom money? But there's been no contact from them...

20050225.text: It might not be a kidnapping.

20050226.text:
Then... perhaps? No... That can't be possible...
Did they cut off communication because they didn't like me?

20050227.text: (I can't say or do anything except for lowering my head...)

20050228.text: Ah... You think it could be true?

20050231.text:
It's that weird old man! <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Won Tozi</>!
How did you get here?

20050232.text:
Call me old weirdo <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Won Tozi</>!
He may look different, but I can tell who he is.

20050233.text: You admit that you're an old weirdo?

20050234.text:
Well... I have to admit, that sounds like me.
Is that what you're most curious about right now?

20050235.text:
Aren't you wondering who these people are?
They're the missing scholars.

20050236.text:
Our bodies changed like this during our research.
We believe it to be contagious...

20050237.text:
Gramps, you don't have many years left to live.
You should get away from here.

20050238.text: Don't waste your life on this research.

20050239.text: Hmm... Please keep what you've seen here a secret.

20050240.text:
I'll investigate this and cure them of this disease.
First, I have to take them back to my <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>research site</>.

20050241.text: It's too dangerous if it's contagious.

20050242.text:
How do you know it's contagious?
Until I have evidence, I won't assume that.

20050244.text:
Oh, is he an expert on that disease, then?
In that case, why consult a physician?

20050245.text:
I'll do what I have to do...
You can go now.

20050246.text: What are you going to do with the scholars?

20050247.text:
Don't worry about me and just go.
There's no evidence that it's contagious.

20050248.text: Is there a solution if it is contagious?

20050249.text:
Everything has a solution.
The only problem is whether I can completely solve this issue.

20050250.text:
That's why we must identify the cause.
The first hypothesis is that it's contagious, as they say it is.

20050251.text:
It may also come from that notorious monster, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Venomous Mutant</>, from the south.
It might be the source of the disease.

20050253.text:
I don't know.
I'm just listing the possibilities.

20050254.text: But, if it was contagious, it's strange that only the geologists are being affected.

20050255.text:
On the contrary, I believe there's something in the rocks or dirt we're researching.
Could you help me investigate?

20050256.text:
Could you gather the samples here?
We'll be able to shed some light on all this if we investigate it.

20050257.text:
Isn't it too dangerous if there turns out
to be something in the rocks or dirt?

20050258.text:
Ah! Right. You're absolutely right!
If that hypothesis is correct, it will certainly be dangerous.

20050259.text:
Then, I'll be the one to collect the sample.
Please keep an eye on the area while I do my work.

20050260.text:
If this is true... It's not just the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>geologists</>,
but all the scholars at work here are in danger.

20050261.text:
Everyone who came into contact
with the rocks and dirt are in danger.

20050262.text:
Right. The stonemasons could be in danger, too.
Since we don't do any farming here yet, we can pass on that...

20050263.text: The crew spending time near the rocks are also in danger.

20050265.text:
Certainly. We must investigate
as quickly as possible and save whoever we can.

20050267.text:
I must go to my <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>research site</>.
I have things I need to deliver and things I'm expecting to arrive.

20050268.text: The journey may be long and dangerous.

20050269.text: Even so, we still have to go. I made a promise.

20050271.text:
Thank you, but no. It's my first mission as a researcher.
I have to do this myself.

20050272.text: If you arrive at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Destroyed Rocks</>, follow the wide road...

20050273.text: I was told if I encountered a monster, I should hide and move carefully checking my surroundings.

20050274.text: The monsters may find out if we make any noise, so we should be quiet.

20050277.text: I'm fine. I'm not nervous at all.

20050279.text:
It's no problem. There are people waiting for this equipment.
We must hurry.

20050281.text: It's really fine. I ate half of my relaxation pills, after all.

20050282.text: I don't see it yet, but from what I've been told, we just need to go a little further.

20050284.text: Ah. I guess walking diligently without giving up was the right choice.

20050286.text: It's all thanks to you. All I did to become a scholar was study all alone at home.

20050287.text: I had no idea there were so many dangerous things in the outside world.

20050288.text: Then again, there are also people like you who help others.

20050289.text: I'll work hard so that I can help others with my research!

20050291.text:
Greetings, warrior!
I have a favor to ask of you.

20050292.text: I want to get my hands on <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglin</> weapons.

20050293.text: There are plenty of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hoglins</> in the area.

20050294.text:
I don't have that much talent when it comes to martial arts,
so it's a little hard to get them myself.

20050295.text:
I know and agree that skills
are what's most important for martial artists.

20050296.text: But, I just can't shake off my interest in weapons and gear.

20050297.text:
I mean, if a strong warrior gets better gear, 
it's obvious that warrior would be stronger.

20050299.text: Then, I'll leave it to you.

20050301.text:
This... It's the same weapon,
but it has a different shape and quality.

20050303.text:
It's certainly a little crude
at first glance.

20050304.text: Well, I'll give it a closer inspection.

20050305.text:
Even if it may look crude, there must 
be a reason why they made it this way.

20050306.text:
And if I research into the design,
I believe I can get something out of it.

20050308.text: Please, you've got to help settle something for me!

20050310.text: There're a lot of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpions</> living in <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Autumn Sunset Valley</>.

20050311.text: But no matter how I think about it, the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</>'s trademark is its poison!

20050312.text: Poison comes to mind when I think of a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Scorpion</>.

20050313.text: Right? Don't you agree that a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</>'s main weapon is its poison?

20050314.text:
But you know what? 
That young merchant over there doesn't know anything.

20050315.text:
He claims a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</>'s main weapon is its <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</>.
I mean, that's absurd!

20050316.text:
He won't listen to me.
So, could you please tell him?

20050317.text:
(I should tell the story
about the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</>.)

20050318.text:
You can think of it that way.
That's the simple way to see it, though!

20050319.text:
Actually, a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</> with lethal poison
is a pretty weak <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</>.

20050320.text:
It uses poison to protect itself
because it's physically weak.

20050321.text:
A <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</> with strong <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</>
doesn't really need poison.

20050322.text:
Does a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpion</> with strong <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</>
have weak poison?

20050323.text:
Yes, and that's because it has no need for lethal poison.
It already has its <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</>!

20050324.text:
Its power is in its pincers!
Why would it sting, then, slowly inflicting its venom? That takes too long!

20050325.text: Poison doesn't kill instantly, so wouldn't it get into danger if it's counterattacked?

20050326.text:
People avoid <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpions</> with lethal poison.
However, the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>scorpions</> with powerful <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</> are strong enough to just attack whoever they want.

20050327.text:
Scorpions with powerful <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>pincers</> are fast, too.
It's really terrifying!

20050330.text: Ah! But, how should we compare the two?

20050331.text: Well, we would try comparing their intensity and hardness.

20050332.text: Or compare the lethality if they were both poison...

20050334.text:
No, no! 
We weren't asking you to do more.

20050335.text:
Now that things have turned out this way,
I realize our argument really was absurd.

20050336.text:
I always get into strange arguments
when I talk to that guy.

20050339.text: Is it? I thought it was normal.

20050340.text: Your voice is loud as well.

20050341.text:
I'm in charge of logging at <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.
And I need to raise my voice when I'm at work.

20050342.text: Ah! Anyways, we have a problem.

20050343.text: There are too many <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandaravas</> at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Lumber Camp</>.

20050344.text:
The workers are refusing to work
because of the danger they pose.

20050345.text: I took care of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandaravas</> at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Lumber Camp</>.

20050347.text:
The <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Mandaravas</> are dangerous.
And they're very noisy.

20050350.text: Is that so? I must've been too focused on my work.

20050351.text:
You should go seek a Healer.
Your hearing may have been damaged from the noise.

20050352.text: Ah. I never thought of it that way, but you have a point.

20050353.text:
There should be hearing protection
for the workers working on the field.

20050354.text: That's really good advice! I'll try reporting it right away.

20050355.text:
You don't look all right.
Is everything okay?

20050356.text: I'm fine. I'm used to this.

20050357.text:
It's not okay to be
used to being sick...

20050358.text: Maybe? I don't have a choice, though.

20050359.text:
I don't know why, but when I see a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gray Darkhorn</>...
My legs shake, and my heart starts pounding...

20050360.text:
I can't make a fist,
and my body gets sluggish.

20050361.text:
Do you have bad memories 
about <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Darkhorns</>?

20050362.text:
No. It's nothing like that.
It's just how I've always responded to them.

20050363.text:
I thought maybe it's a fear of
giant monsters or anything disgusting...

20050364.text:
But then, I'm not affected
that way by anything else.

20050365.text:
I'll take care of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Darkhorns</>.
How about that?

20050366.text:
To the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Shelter of the Forest</>? I could
if there're fewer <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gray Darkhorns</>...

20050368.text: I'm sorry. I wanted to go...

20050369.text:
But I thought of the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Darkhorns</> on my way.
My legs were trembling so hard, I couldn't even walk.

20050371.text:
You must've taken care of so many <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Darkhorns</>...
I don't know why I'm still so scared.

20050372.text: I don't know if a coward like me is worthy to be part of <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</>.

20050373.text: I should try to find some way to fix this, even if it's too late.

20050374.text: Take some time to think it over.

20050375.text:
Go see a healer.
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Ivory Gale</> should have a good one.

20050376.text: Yes. I will consider that, too.

20050377.text: Hey, would you help settle something for me?

20050379.text: There are <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen</> appearing at the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Gray Jungle</>.

20050380.text: When it comes to the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen</>, you think about their <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</>, don't you?

20050381.text: Rats do remind me of protruding teeth.

20050382.text: Right? I mean, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</> and rats go hand in hand.

20050383.text:
But the problem is that old merchant 
who doesn't know any better.

20050384.text:
He's stubbornly claiming that the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen</>
are all about <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</>, not their teeth.

20050385.text:
He won't listen to me at all,
so could you please get him to understand?

20050386.text:
(I should tell the story
about the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratman</>.)

20050387.text:
Usually, young and immature people
have this obsession about <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</>.

20050388.text: It's like toddlers putting everything to their mouths. Oral fixation!

20050390.text: <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Claws</> are the sign of a grown-up creature.

20050391.text:
If claws aren't managed right, then
they can't be used properly.

20050392.text:
Between attacking with your teeth and attacking with <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</>,
which do you think is smarter?

20050393.text:
I don't think either of them is smart.
But, if I must choose, it would be <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</>.

20050394.text:
Right? <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Claws</>!
You can't imagine anything other than <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</>.

20050395.text: And we can compare the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</> and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</>.

20050396.text: Could you get some of them for us?

20050397.text: Should this be good enough for comparison?

20050399.text:
If we simply compare the intensity
and hardness, the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</> have an obvious advantage.

20050400.text:
Even if I claim that <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</> are better and my logic is perfect...
Will that old merchant admit it?

20050402.text:
I don't know.
But the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Ratmen</> were using weapons of their own design.

20050403.text: What? Even with such strong <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>teeth</> and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>claws</>?

20050405.text: I seem to have an upset stomach. I ate a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</> just now, so maybe that's why?

20050407.text:
It's a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</> growing on the body of a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gnarlox</>.
I happened to just find one on a dead <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gnarlox</>.

20050408.text: The <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</> growing on it grabbed my attention.

20050409.text:
Ah! This! This must be delicious!
I came to that conclusion.

20050411.text:
It was a little bitter. But for that kind of bitterness,
I can certainly learn to enjoy it.

20050412.text:
If it's a poisonous <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</>... 
That <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</> needs to be investigated.

20050413.text:
No, it's fine.
My stomach will calm down eventually.

20050414.text:
Do you know where
this woman has gone to?

20050415.text: Ah, she collapsed and was taken to the healer.

20050417.text:
She must've eaten something weird.
The healer needs to know what it is before treating her.

20050418.text:
She ate a <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Gnarlox</> <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</>.
Here is the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>mushroom</>.

20050419.text: Ah! So this was the problem.

20050420.text: I'll hand it over to the healer.

20050422.text:
Hey! Wait there! 
If you pass by yourself like that, you're in trouble!

20050424.text:
Hey, that <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hongdon tribe</> is incredibly violent. I also lost all of my coverage!
You're lucky to have met me.

20050426.text:
Yes! I'm <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Rookie Myunghye</> on a cross-ethnic investigation.
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]> The Hongdon clan</> are violent, but they can communicate... so I tried to cover it.

20050427.text: At first, he seemed to be curious about the interview, but he suddenly got angry when asked how many bowls of rice a day he eats!

20050429.text:
Anyway, I plan to wait for you to fall asleep and then secretly retrieve the data.
Wait with me too, then quietly pass by.

20050430.text: (He said he would find the material)

20050431.text:
Hey... that's a cool weapon. People don't know about it, but the 
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hongdon</> are a great race with gunsmithing skills as well.

20050432.text:
Most heterogeneous except <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Barong</>, <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Suwa</> Now that we have lost our wisdom, 
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Exchange with the Hongdon clan</> will be a must for each other!

20050433.text:
I can't just give up like this.
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hongdon on <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Red Forest Road</> >I want to meet you too. Would you like to go with me?

20050435.text:
There's a female human! Why do you keep coming back?
Aura <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Weeping</> why don't they even light their noses?

20050436.text: Eh... me? Am I the first to come?

20050437.text:
Kooing? Humans are alike and confused. 
Humans, we have no intention of reconciling unless we keep this promise <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Foster</> !

20050439.text:
Wow! I'm very patient. I'll tell you one last time.
So open your ears and listen carefully!!!!!

20050440.text:
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Weeping</> is the land we will settle if we help clear <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Sea Moon Continent</> You promised to give me money.
We did our best to help humans. But!!!!!!

20050441.text:
But <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Weeping</> didn't pay us anything!
You're always making cowardly excuses.

20050442.text:
We can't stand it any longer. 
We have no choice but to take the land by force!!

20050443.text: Something like that... I didn't even know that...

20050444.text:
My stomach hurts just thinking about it. That's why I can't lose weight!!!!
Human, if you know now, go ahead and tell me.

20050445.text: Okay! I'm sure I'll tell you!

20050446.text:
Obviously the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Red Donkey</> is just annoying.
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Weeping</> is a replacement For what reason did you use <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hongdon</> and throw it away?

20050448.text:
On behalf of mankind, we must regain the lost trust!
Before that, we must also listen to <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Discipline</>. I must be very busy for the time being.

20050449.text:
Thanks for your help!
Then I'll go first!

20050451.text:
...because of my son.
I don't have any friends my age, so I always play alone, and I can't help but feel sorry for him.

20050452.text:
I wonder if I just moved here...
I can't get my job done.

20050453.text: (...you seem to be having a good time alone...)

20050455.text: (He says he'll play for a while)

20050456.text: Really? I'd like to ask you a second!

20050457.text: Who are you! Maybe... you came here to be my assistant, right?

20050458.text: (He seems to be absorbed in the detective game. First he nods his head)

20050459.text:
Ahem! This body is <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Kwon Doi</>!
You have to pass a test to become my assistant!

20050461.text: Where then... do you know how to do martial arts?

20050463.text: So can you catch <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Wolf</> in <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Pungbaekmun Forecourt</>?

20050465.text: Okay! Then show your assistant by killing <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Wolf</>!

20050466.text:
Wow! It's the assistant!
Can the assistant even beat these bad guys?

20050468.text:
Take care of these guys! 
They stole our luggage and harassed us!

20050469.text:
Mr. Kim was seriously injured because of them!
That's why I said <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> all of them were kicked out!

20050470.text: (He will kick you out, so he tells you to calm down)

20050471.text:
I'm so excited!
It's the first time I've come this far, but I also scolded the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Hongdon people</>!

20050472.text: Let's go over that hill over there!

20050473.text: (He says it will be hard to go further)

20050476.text: Cheet...then I'll take you today to the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>secret place</> I'm investigating.

20050477.text: (It's too late, Dad says he's worried)

20050478.text:
Very close! <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Just under Poongbaekmun</>Hey!
It's a very suspicious place. I found it!

20050479.text: Follow me! <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Meet at the bottom of the stairs to Poongbaekmun</>!

20050481.text:
I think... 
This is a terrifying place where deaf people are locked up until they repent!

20050482.text:
Is there a <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Scary Uncle</> who comes here often? 
A ghostly man with long dark hair and a white face!

20050483.text: That <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Uncle</> is here fighting <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Elder</> every day!

20050485.text:
You said nothing? I just got mad and went back. 
'The order is mine!' while doing this.

20050486.text: (From now on, please don't come here alone)

20050488.text: (It's too late, let's go home soon)

20050489.text:
Hey, you're here. 
We're so excited that our <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Doi</> had a great adventure.

20050491.text:
Hey, I know that taking care of a child is hard work.
Thank you very much.

20050493.text:
<textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dungeon</>? This is the first time <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> has such a place. Listen.
I think the <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Moonpawon</> people know better than me.

20050496.text: How did the small council get there... it's... so...

20050497.text: It's not a secret, but for us <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</>, it's embarrassing to say that it's such a cheesy place.

20050498.text:
Hmm... That underground facility was not made by us. 
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Black Dawn</>... made it.

20050499.text:
Probably <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> soon settled here,
so <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>black I'm guessing it was created around the time the dawn </> was created.

20050500.text:
...they said they expected there to be a hiding place nearby at the time, but 
no one seems to have doubted under their feet.

20050501.text:
I didn't get rid of that mistake so I wouldn't forget it,
I didn't know there were children coming and going.

20050502.text: We will discuss with the other elders to make a closure.

20050504.text:
Hey, I won't refuse. Let's see... I can't get enough of ordinary wood from the water...
Ah! Hard <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Aged maple</> Could you please save me?

20050505.text:
You are very talented.
You must have collected them all...

20050506.text:
Oops, <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Prison</> has decided to close. 
What I'm doing is to create a playground for children.

20050507.text: I am going to go to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Lumberjack</> with the workers because it looks like it will be a full-fledged construction project.

20050508.text: So... can you help me clear the way?

20050510.text:
Thanks for your help.
Thanks to you, I can safely cut down trees.

20050511.text:
...even now... on that hill there are many inspectors of <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> 
<textColor=[215:94:94:255]>We are fighting the Black Dawn</>.

20050512.text:
When the <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>The Black Dawn</> begin to hatch in our <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Underground of Poongbaekmun</> , 
If you plucked those buds back then...

20050513.text:
If that was the case, so many people wouldn't have been hurt and suffered as much as they do now.
It's a thing of the past, but everyone at <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> has the same regrets. will have it.

20050514.text: So... other things seem to have been trivial and not looked at closely.

20050515.text:
I held on to a busy person and offered only exhaustive excuses.
Now~~Now, leave the rest to me.

20050516.text:
You can stop now! How long are you going to be like this?
The Vice-Captain has done enough!

20050518.text: Let's go back together. Please, okay?

20050519.text: (What's going on? Let's go and hear the story.)

20050522.text:
...do you know of the huge fertility mining incident that took place here in the past?
This man was <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Chief of Discipline</> at the time.

20050523.text: He was the one who insisted that <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Pungbaekmun</> secretly mine fertility.

20050524.text:
On a tragic day, send all your troops to this <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>dig</> for support
I am <textColor=[78:148:215:255]> It is said that they performed a sole mission to divert the gaze of Pungbaekmun</>.

20050525.text:
...that's how he survived the tragedy alone.
All his crew and allies have turned into <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>verse verse</>.

20050526.text:
But do you think this figure is alive?
If you scream in front of you or swear, you won't hear me.

20050528.text:
You're trying to find a peaceful death... for your subordinates who have become <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Sciences</>.
With your own hands... End all You will carry the guilt yourself. Uh huh...

20050529.text:
Since this area is so dangerous, I take turns watching with my colleagues...
I'm worried that I won't be able to come for a while.

20050533.text:
I'm sorry... I'm sorry... 
Please don't forgive the bad commander...

20050535.text: How did you come up with all that?

20050537.text: It's been a while since I've seen you cry like that...

20050538.text: You look great, can you help a little more?

20050539.text:
This <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Fertile Surround</> is full of <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Burnts</>.
 It's a dangerous place for a weary old man to go back alone.

20050541.text: Thank you. I haven't been able to keep going, but I'm glad I met Sohyup.

20050542.text: (<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Wild Conservation Society</> asks what's going on so far)

20050543.text:
You?! Help me!
It's an urgent matter with a life at stake!

20050544.text: (Keep your excitement down and tell him)

20050545.text:
Huh... I recently came to this fertile land to track 
deer antlers that are illegally circulating in <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Suwol Plains</>.

20050546.text:
By the way! That's where those brutal <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Burners</> are settling in!
I should go and report this...

20050547.text:
I can't stop walking when I see deer dying with their antlers cut off.
I beg you. Help me.

20050548.text:
Thanks to you, we rescued all the deer that were captured.
It's a terrible thing to be slaughtered indiscriminately because of their beautiful antlers.

20050549.text:
I'm planning to go back to <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Soowol Plains</> only seeing this guy recover.
Go, announce this and <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Action </> should ask for assistance.

20050550.text:
Thanks for your help. 
Let's meet again then!

20050551.text: Aww! I was surprised! I thought it was <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>mutated Samyojeong</>!

20050553.text: <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>I have a herb that I urgently need to send to the desert</>, so I came to look for <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Lingling</> alone !

20050555.text:
If you go a little further towards the sunrise, there is <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>a wide and hot desert</> nyang~
It's so hot over there that a lot of people get heat stroke. !

20050556.text: A little scary, but <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Lingling</> should do it!

20050558.text:
Really? 
Then help me find the <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Coolgunggung Flower</>!

20050559.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Flower of the cool breeze</> grows where the cold wind blows and 
the smell of the dawning dawn blows!

20050561.text:
Then please protect me by my side.
Actually <textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Lingling</>Eunnyang... <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Samyojeong</> is also scary, <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Pussy </> is also very scary!

20050562.text:
Look at this~! 
<textColor=[78:148:215:255]>Lingling</> I found it by myself!

20050564.text:
But there's still one more left... 
To make a cure for heat stroke, you'll also need to get <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Watertail Grass</>!

20050566.text:
Woah! It's the best! <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Watertail grass</>Eun-nyang~ 
It smells like warm salt and grows in a place where the fresh sunlight shines~!

20050567.text:
Wow! This is <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Watertail Grass</>Nyanya!
<myHero.name/><ga/> Did you find it? That's great. Nyan!

20050570.text:
As long as you only have these <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Cool Gingerbread Flowers</> and <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Watertail Grass</>~
The travelers who ate the heat in the desert will be able to recover safely~!

20050571.text:
I'll have to bring it to you soon!
Then we'll see you again~!

20050572.text:
I... are you a traveler? 
We've been robbed of money and everything, but... if there's any leftover food...

20050573.text: Ugh... The name of the honeymoon is... To beg for food today...

20050575.text:
Didn't you see <textColor=[215:94:94:255]>Spears</> on the way?
They gave them money, gifts, and even a suitcase! They stole it all!

20050576.text: (The newlyweds ask what's going on here.)

20050577.text: I... for no reason asked me to take a boat ride at <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Dragonhead Cape</>... so black

20050578.text:
These days, it is fashionable for young newlyweds to go on long-term trips to the Haewol Continent.
Although I usually only go around the safe <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Taerokrim</>.

20050579.text: (It's dangerous here, so please go back)

20050580.text:
Yeah... it was very dangerous... I desperately felt it. 
Thank you for saving my life, but I don't have any money, so there's no way I can go back...

20050581.text: (He said he would find the luggage)

20050583.text:
That big guy got a <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Gold bag</>, and your girlfriend with a bow <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Gift</>I stole it!
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>The suitcase</> was picked up by a young man and carried through that fence!!!

20050584.text: I told you to prepare a big bang, what are you doing with these little bastards?

20050585.text: Oh my gosh, that's what he said he was looking for <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Luggage</>...

20050587.text: Hurry up, you guys! I'm going to go find my treasure! Cuckoo

20050588.text: Hey, you spying rat. You're lucky today.

20050589.text:
Hey, you're here! Are you not hurt anywhere?
Oh my God...! I guess that's it!!

20050590.text:
<textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Gold bag</>, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Gift</>, <textColor=[255:204:102:255]>Travel bag</>...
Thank you, Daehyup! Thank you so much!

20050591.text: Huh~~ Now that I'm relieved, the beautiful scenery catches my eye.

20050592.text:
Really!~ The beautiful Mt. Geumsugang, and even the kind guest~ 
Suddenly, the <textColor=[110:216:175:255]>Fertile Land</> is so good?

20050593.text:
Shall we settle here soon?
I heard that immigration support policies are good these days!

20050594.text: It's me, I'm fine wherever I am with you~

20050596.text:
Oops, Daehyup! Here's a small castle. 
Thank you so much for making our honeymoon a pleasant memory!

20050597.text:
Isn't it <myHero.name/>?
Did Lord Moon come with you?

20050599.text:
Ah... that's right. I need Munju-sama's action right now... 
How do you do this?

20050601.text:
I'm not sure how to explain it... 
Have you ever experienced cracks?

20050603.text:
You know... 
the unpleasant dark aura you can feel when you go near a rift.

20050604.text: The aura... A place filled with that aura that cannot be described in words has appeared.

20050605.text: (surprised and asks if there is such a dangerous place)

20050606.text:
Yeah. So when Master Moon came, I was going to go together... 
After this, I'll have to go alone.

20050607.text:
(You don't know what will happen
He said he would go with him)

20050608.text:
(You can see a huge gap that seems to be connected somewhere and 
You can see the Biryu River standing in front of it)

20050610.text:
(Ask if you want to 
enter the crevice of Biryuha)

20050611.text:
I originally intended to do that...
The Bulma energy is so much stronger than I expected.

20050612.text:
That's why I'm going to investigate
information around me until Lord Moon comes.

20050613.text: Are you planning to enter the small cooperative?

20050615.text:
Be careful.
You can feel the energy of a huge fire inside.

20050616.text:
Probably, there are high-level bullies that you can't see outside... 
I guess.

20050618.text:
It seems too dangerous to deal with. 
I need to prepare thoroughly.

20050620.text:
Then I'll start scouting around.
Please take care.
